subclusters.subcluster_name: Senescence Spread and Paracrine Signaling Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on irreparable telomeric DNA damage and persistent DDR signaling as a cause of senescence and aging.
Centers on replicative senescence driven by telomere shortening and its role in aging and stem cell heterogeneity.
Describes replicative senescence as a tumor suppressor and aging mechanism linked to telomere shortening.
Emphasizes telomere shortening triggering replicative senescence and SASP contributing to aging diseases.
Highlights replicative senescence and telomere dysfunction as biomarkers and drivers of aging in primates.
Focuses on senescence-to-immortality switch involving telomerase reactivation and telomere maintenance in cancer and aging.
Links genetic variation in telomerase and cell cycle control to aging, emphasizing telomere maintenance mechanisms.
Describes multiple senescence origins including replicative exhaustion (telomere shortening) and their impact on skin aging.
Focuses on senescence as a stress response with emphasis on SASP, immunosenescence, and inflammaging driving aging.
Highlights the dual role of senescence and SASP in development, regeneration, and aging-related pathology.
Distinguishes SASP as a damage-response phenotype and explores p16INK4a-induced senescence independent of SASP.
Emphasizes SASP and extracellular vesicles in senescence, with key molecular pathways p53/p21 and p16INK4a/pRB.
Focuses on SASP-driven inflammation and dual roles of senescence in physiology and pathology.
Details SASP's role in chronic inflammation, tissue dysfunction, and therapeutic targeting of senescent cells.
Describes SASP's role in neuropathology and neurodegeneration linking senescence to systemic aging diseases.
Focuses on endothelial cell senescence and SASP-mediated systemic metabolic dysfunction and insulin resistance.
Describes accumulation of senescent cells and SASP-driven inflammaging impairing regeneration and promoting aging.
Explores tumor suppression by senescence and antagonistic pleiotropy with SASP contributing to aging phenotypes.
Details molecular mechanisms of senescence involving RB/p53 pathways and SASP in tissue homeostasis and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence Spread and Paracrine Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on paracrine and juxtacrine spread of senescence via SASP and NOTCH signaling, controlling senescence lesion propagation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence Spread and Paracrine Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes systemic propagation of senescence through circulating factors and rejuvenation by senolytic interventions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence Spread and Paracrine Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links IGF-I induced senescence via ROS-p53 pathway, highlighting oxidative stress and signaling in senescence induction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence Spread and Paracrine Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes PLA2R1-mediated tumor suppression via ROS-Rb-PARP1 pathway causing DNA damage and senescence induction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence Spread and Paracrine Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on transcriptional fidelity loss and chromatin remodeling as features of senescence affecting gene expression and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence Spread and Paracrine Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links psychosocial stress to cellular senescence via oxidative stress and transcriptional control pathways influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence Spread and Paracrine Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes autophagy decline mechanisms during aging that contribute to cellular dysfunction and senescence-related aging.
